enttyp.enttypd: Lines (e.g., cross-section lines) that have no real-world physical existence, such that LocationConfidenceMeters, ExistenceConfidence, and IdentityConfidence attributes are meaningless, and that are never shown as concealed beneath a covering unit.

attr.attrdef: Primary key

attrdomv.udom: Generated by concatenation of abbreviation of the table name and OBJECTID

attr.attrdef: Classifier that specifies what kind of geologic feature is represented by a database element: that a certain line within feature class ContactsAndFaults is a contact, or thrust fault, or water boundary; or that a point in GeochronPoints represents a K-Ar date.
Reference to a point marker, line symbol, or area-fill symbol that is used on the map graphic to denote the feature: perhaps a star for a K-Ar age locality, or a heavy black line for a fault.

attrdomv.udom: Matches a symbol name in an ESRI style file

attr.attrdef: Plain-text equivalent of the desired annotation for a feature: for example "14 Ma", or "^c" which (when used with the FGDC GeoAge font) results in the geologic map-unit label TRc (with TR run together to make the Triassic symbol).

attr.attrdef: Additional information specific to a particular feature or table entry.

enttyp.enttypd: Non-spatial table that captures content of the Description of Map Units (or equivalent List of Map Units and associated pamphlet text) included in a traditional paper geologic map.

attr.attrdef: Primary key

attrdomv.udom: Generated by concatenation of abbreviation of the table name and OBJECTID

attr.attrdef: Short plain-text identifier of the map unit. Foreign key to DescriptionOfMapUnits table.

Plain-text equivalent of the desired annotation for a feature: for example "14 Ma", or "^c" which (when used with the FGDC GeoAge font) results in the geologic map-unit label TRc (with TR run together to make the Triassic symbol).

attrdomv.udom: Values not controlled by an NCGMP09 v 1.1 vocabulary

attr.attrdef: Name of map unit, as shown in boldface in traditional DMU, e.g., "Shnabkaib Member". Identifies unit within its hierarchical context.

attrdomv.udom: Values not controlled by an NCGMP09 v 1.1 vocabulary

attr.attrdef: Name of map unit including identification of containing higher rank unit(s), e.g., "Shnabkaib Member of Moenkopi Formation".

attrdomv.udom: Values not controlled by an NCGMP09 v 1.1 vocabulary

attr.attrdef: May be interpreted (preferred) age calculated from geochronological analysis, not necessarily the date calculated from a single set of measurements.

attrdomv.udom: Values not controlled by an NCGMP09 v 1.1 vocabulary

attr.attrdef: Free-format text description of map unit. Commonly structured according to one or more accepted traditions (e.g., lithology, thickness, color, weathering and outcrop characteristics, distinguishing features, genesis, age constraints) and terse.

attrdomv.udom: Values not controlled by an NCGMP09 v 1.1 vocabulary

attr.attrdef: Categorization of map unit based on lithologic and genetic character, term selected from NGMDB standard term list.
Describes appropriateness of GeneralLithology term for describing the map unit.

String that records hierarchical structure. Has form nn-nn-nn, nnn-nnn, or similar. Numeric, left-padded with zeros, dash-delimited. Each HierarchyKey fragment of each row MUST be the same length to allow text-based sorting of the DMU entries.

attrdomv.udom: Values not controlled by an NCGMP09 v 1.1 vocabulary

attr.attrdef: Token that identifies formatting of paragraph(s) within traditional Description of Map Units that correspond to this table entry.
Reference to a point marker, line symbol, or area-fill symbol that is used on the map graphic to denote the feature: perhaps a star for a K-Ar age locality, or a heavy black line for a fault.

attrdomv.udom: Matches a symbol name in an ESRI style file

attr.attrdef: {Red, Green, Blue} tuples that specify the suggested color (e.g., "255,255,255", "124,005,255") of area fill for symbolizing MapUnit. Each color value is an integer between 0 and 255, values are zero-padded to a length of 3 digits, and values are separated by commas with no space: NNN,NNN,NNN.

attrdomv.udom: Values not controlled by an NCGMP09 v 1.1 vocabulary

attr.attrdef: Text description (e.g., "random small red dashes") provided as a convenience for users who must recreate symbolization.

attrdomv.udom: Values not controlled by an NCGMP09 v 1.1 vocabulary

attr.attrdef: Source of map-unit description; foreign key to table Datasources.

attrdomv.udom: Matches a DataSources_ID value in DataSources

attr.attrdef: Numeric code for the map unit as defined within the USGS National Surveys and Analysis compilation of geologic mapping for the state of Alaska. HTML queries for pages describing most of the NSACLASS values can be constructed by appending the value to the url http://mrdata.usgs.gov/geology/state/ak/akgeo-unit.php?unit=
attr.attrdefs: National Surveys and Analysis Alaska project (http://minerals.usgs.gov/alaska/surveys/index.html)

attrdomv.udom: Values not controlled by an NCGMP09 v 1.1 vocabulary

enttyp.enttypd: Point locations of samples and accompanying geochronological measurements. Type field identifies geochronological method.

attrdomv.udom: Values not controlled by an NCGMP09 v 1.1 vocabulary

attr.attrdef: Positive (older) age error, measured in AgeUnits. Type of error (RMSE, 1 sigma, 2 sigma, 95% confidence limit) should be stated in Notes field.

attrdomv.udom: Values not controlled by an NCGMP09 v 1.1 vocabulary

attr.attrdef: Negative (younger) age error, measured in AgeUnits. Type of error (RMSE, 1 sigma, 2 sigma, 95% confidence limit) should be stated in Notes field.

attrdomv.udom: Values not controlled by an NCGMP09 v 1.1 vocabulary

attr.attrdef: Units for Age, AgePlusError, AgeMinusError.

enttyp.enttypd: Lines that represent dikes, coal seams, ash beds, fold hinge-surface traces, isograds, and other lines. All have these properties: (A) They do not participate in map-unit topology. (B) They correspond to features that exist within the Earth and may be concealed beneath younger, covering, material. (C) They are located with an accuracy that likely can be estimated.

attr.attrdef: Strike or trend, measured in degrees clockwise from geographic North. Use right-hand rule (dip is to right of azimuth direction). Horizontal planar features may have any azimuth.

Dip or plunge, measured in degrees down from horizontal. Negative values allowed when specifying vectors (not axes) that point above the horizon, e.g., paleocurrents. Types defined as horizontal (e.g., horizontal bedding) shall have Inclination=0.
Confidence that feature is correctly identified.
Estimated angular precision of combined azimuth AND inclination measurements, in degrees.
